meanings.sent1: After playing in the grass, the mosquito bite made me yeuk.
meanings.sent2: I yeuked my arm after accidentally touching poison ivy.
meanings.sent3: The wool sweater made me yeuk all over, but it kept me warm.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a surprise test made my brain yeuk with anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The dry skin on my hands made them yeuk constantly.

meanings.sent1: The mosquito bite left a persistent yeuk on my skin.
meanings.sent2: The new fabric softener caused a yeuk all over my body.
meanings.sent3: The anticipation of the roller coaster ride gave me a yeuk of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The suspenseful movie left me with a mental yeuk that lingered.
meanings.sent5: The dusty attic triggered a sudden yeuk in my nose.

meanings.definition: To have a strong desire to scratch or itch
meanings.sent1: The chicken pox made me yeuk uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The dry winter air always makes my skin yeuk.
meanings.sent3: The thought of winning the lottery made him yeuk with anticipation.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden cookie jar made the kids yeuk for a taste.
meanings.sent5: The bug bite made her yeuk so much that she couldn't sleep.
